post.body:
I know nothing about Kratom, but there is evidence that cannabis oil (aka Rick Simpson Oil or RSO) cures many cancers, and has many other medicinal uses. No, it isn't FDA approved, and probably never will be. Nobody is going to spend those millions of dollars getting approval for a common weed.

CBD oil, made from non-psychoactive hemp, is useful for lots of things. But some conditions respond only to the psychoactive variety. Cannabis Indica, which gives a body high, and tends to put you to sleep, apparently works better than Cannabis Sativa, which gives a head high.

I'm not a stoner. Been there. Done that. 35 years ago. God works better than drugs. But if I get cancer, RSO will be the first thing I try.

http://phoenixtears.ca

post.body:
Somebody should start a new Group exclusively for cannabis products.  I don't mind discussion of proven health benefits from herbs that God created, but I am getting tired as hell of having to read every fck'n cannabis post to determine whether it's a sales pitch, reasonable article, dope deal, or spam.  I've deleted several product sales pitches.  People should start their own group if they have a product to sell, or give me a big fucking $$ commission $$ for taking up my time with it.

I would prefer to spend time on herbs that are covered in books written by the top herbalists, like Steven Foster and such.  If cannabis has helped somebody to heal from a disease, I am very happy to hear about such things and praise the Good Lord for his medicinal plants and herbs. But if people use these herbs just to get stupid, that is comedy material for some other group. Been down that road when I was young and stupid, and I ain't going back ;)

parent.body:
The reason the volunteer Welcome Committee members give information on muting to newbies is because we have all seen the harassment and targeting of newbies here.  I could point out at least 50 people who’ve given up on Gab because within hours of their start there’s been a barrage of tranny porn, child porn, plain porn with no NSFW tag, and/or obviously mentally ill people hating on them.  It has been a REAL problem.  One of the groups of ladies here left Gab all together because of several persistent tranny posters. We told them about tools for muting, and they came back to Gab.

We don’t tell people WHO to mute. That’s up to each person.  It’s Free Speech here, but that doesn’t mean we’re a captive audience. In real life you can walk away from a speech, stop reading a book, etc. Here you can mute.

So don’t blame the welcome committee  for teaching about muting. Blame the assholes who think their free speech gives them the right to gang up on newbies to spew hatred and porn in an effort to make them leave Gab.

parent.body:
Welcome to Gab, Ronald!
I’m a volunteer member of the Welcome Committee here so I hope you don’t mind a long post.
For the basics of Gab see https://help.gab.com

It’s free speech here and if you’re new you’ve probably seen some ugly stuff.  That’s what Mute is for! When you see obviously hateful accounts, please mute them.  These are trolls in hiding trying to hurt Gab and keep new users from joining. Don’t fall for this trap. Mute, mute, mute. Let them spew into silence. (See drop down menu—3 dots in top RH corner of post for Mute User.)

You might also want to try Introducing Yourself here in this group. 
Introduce Yourself https://gab.ai/groups/398c3c05-c722-484a-9264-b94f165d6656

If you have any questions then just ask any or all of the volunteer welcome committee: @TienLeung , @JPerkinsJune @BOBOFkake @R_Olney,  @SteveSmith @ Millwood16 @MagicGenie , @ ROCKintheUSSA, 
@ Joeljustwokeup, @knitwit,@ militanthippy, @deplorableBuilder, @LibertyLion @BetterNot2Know, @PorkyPig205, @SkepticalPr0thean  
❤️🐸 

If you want to follow Pres. Trump, @RealTrumpTweets is a Gab volunteer who mirrors all of Trump’s tweets. Also you may want to follow @realdonaldtrump Gab account that Gab has reserved for the President. 
         
Top 6 Ways To Participate, Add Value and Gain Followers (aka increase your audience): 

1. Follow others, MANY others. Check their profile page first!! Most will follow back.  
2. Start regularly posting ORIGINAL material/content. This can not be stressed enough! 
3.Posting from your home page, especially with few followers means hardly anyone will see your posts. For more visibility, start your posts from a topic, category or group. Reposting is fine BUT...DO NOT ONLY RE-POST. Make sure you have other content too. 
4.Join a group. Participate in the groups discussions. 
5. Reply to other GABers posts. If you want to ADD some commentary to their post, you use the "Quote" button. 
6. Make sure you have some kind of profile image/photo. Many won't follow if you do not.

Top 6 Ways To Participate, Add Value and Gain Followers (aka increase your audience): 

1. Follow others, MANY others. Check their profile page first!! Most will follow back.

6. Make sure you have some kind of profile image/photo. Many won't follow if you do not.

post.body:
Yow! I didn't do so well at English, only 670, but 800 in math. MIT rocked!

I had two requirements for a college:

1) It mustn't say "(statistics)" next to "Mathematics" in the catalog. Statistics is cool, but I wanted to write proofs, not learn how to lie with numbers. MIT passed.

2) It must have a jazz band. MIT sent their jazz band to the Notre Dame Jazz festival every year. To do that, Herb had five charts written just for the band, and we worked on them all year long. Thus could a bunch of engineers, who played their horns a few times a week, join soon-to-be professional musicians at Notre Dame. It probably also helped that Herb Pomeroy was directing.

parent.body:
1.Teaching Math In the 1960s
A logger sells a truckload of lumber for $100. His cost of
production is 4/5 of the price. What is his profit?

2.Teaching Math In the 1970s
A logger sells a truckload of lumber for $100. His cost of
production is 4/5 of the price, or $80. What is his profit?

3.Teaching Math In the 1980s
A logger sells a truckload of lumber for $100. His cost of
production is $80. Did he make a profit? Yes or No

4.Teaching Math In the 1990s
A logger sells a truckload of lumber for $100. 
His cost of production is $80 and his profit is $20.
Your assignment: Underline the number 20.

5.Teaching Math In 2018
(a) A logger cuts down a beautiful forest because he is selfish and
inconsiderate and cares nothing for the habitat of animals or the
preservation of our woodlands. He does this so he can make a profit
of just $20.
What do you think of this way of making a living?
(b) Topic for class participation after answering question (a):
How did the birds and squirrels feel as the logger cut down their homes?
Please note: There are no wrong answers - feel free to express your
feelings e.g. anger, anxiety, inadequacy, helplessness etc.
(Should you require debriefing at the conclusion of the exam, there are
counselors available to assist you to adjust back into the real world.)

6.Teaching Math In 2050

post.body:
Yow! I didn't do so well at English, only 670, but 800 in math. MIT rocked!

I had two requirements for a college:

1) It mustn't say "(statistics)" next to "Mathematics" in the catalog. Statistics is cool, but I wanted to write proofs, not learn how to lie with numbers. MIT passed.

2) It must have a jazz band. MIT sent their jazz band to the Notre Dame Jazz festival every year. To do that, Herb had five charts written just for the band, and we worked on them all year long. Thus could a bunch of engineers, who played their horns a few times a week, join soon-to-be professional musicians at Notre Dame. It probably also helped that Herb Pomeroy was directing.

post.body:
GabDecker update.

I've been using it every day, to read the three provided feeds. I click on the links to go to Gab.com, if I want to interact.

I'm working on the ability to add and remove feed columns, and to persist them in your browser's `LocalStorage`.

After that, I'll add the interactive functions, post/reply/quote/like/upvote/downvote/repost

Then the notifications feed.

A reminder to @developers that a POST to https://api.gab.com/v1.0/posts still gets a 429 error, "Too Many Requests".

TODO list: https://github.com/melon-love/gabdecker/blob/master/TODO.md 

I've also decided how I'll make money. I'll show one simple ad, with link, in each column, until you pay me $1/month for a subscription.

I need to find an ad provider other than Google, since that will cause lots of potential users to avoid GabDecker. And I need to find a payment processor. Suggestions?

Of course, the simplest payment processor is check / money order / cash in the mail, but that requires revealing my address to the world, or getting a PO box in a nearby town. I'll have to think on whether I want to do that. Not that it's hard to find.

I could support crypto, but after being burned by MT.GOX, whose bankruptcy is still in process, I'm hesitant to rely on converting crypto to FRNs. If I could buy food and rent with crypto, it would be a different matter, but so far I can't.

I plan to store on my server only Gab username and expiration date, and nothing else. Expiration warnings will appear on screen, until told to go away.

GabDecker update.

I've been using it every day, to read the three provided feeds. I click on the links to go to Gab.com, if I want to interact.

I'm working on the ability to add and remove feed columns, and to persist them in your browser's `LocalStorage`.

After that, I'll add the interactive functions, post/reply/quote/like/upvote/downvote/repost

Then the notifications feed.

A reminder to @developers that a POST to https://api.gab.com/v1.0/posts still gets a 429 error, "Too Many Requests".

TODO list: https://github.com/melon-love/gabdecker/blob/master/TODO.md

I've also decided how I'll make money. I'll show one simple ad, with link, in each column, until you pay me $1/month for a subscription.

I need to find an ad provider other than Google, since that will cause lots of potential users to avoid GabDecker. And I need to find a payment processor. Suggestions?

Of course, the simplest payment processor is check / money order / cash in the mail, but that requires revealing my address to the world, or getting a PO box in a nearby town. I'll have to think on whether I want to do that. Not that it's hard to find.

I could support crypto, but after being burned by MT.GOX, whose bankruptcy is still in process, I'm hesitant to rely on converting crypto to FRNs. If I could buy food and rent with crypto, it would be a different matter, but so far I can't.

I plan to store on my server only Gab username and expiration date, and nothing else. Expiration warnings will appear on screen, until told to go away.

post.body:
I would like an option to get comments from the API's user feed, e.g.:

https://api.gab.com/v1.0/users/{username}/feed/?before=2018-10-03T19:35:47+00:00&comments=1

Without the comments parameter, it would work as it does now. With the comments parameter, it would return all posts by the user, including comments.

@a @developers
